divs: Sighting DetailsSaw whitest light, huge compared to stars, caught my eye, as I stared at sky looking for satellites. I turned and looked to west, nearly straight up, saw this light. Much bigger than the ISS I have seen orbit, then some sparkles appeared at its tail end, and these were yellow. I thought i may have witnessed a satellite burning up in the atmosphere, but wouldn't it have gone faster and created more of a show and burned longer. I observed this for only about 7-10 seconds, maybe a bit longer. When the sparks appeared at the tail end, the thingy just disappeared shortly after. It was a huge patch of white and no way this can be compared to a star or a shooting star. I welcome any suggestions as to what it could have been.
Summary: Whitest light, huge compared to stars, few seconds then disappeared
trends: There have been 11 other sightings in Lansing Charter Township
There were no other sightings in Lansing Charter Township on or around July 26th 2011
